pkgmetadata.longdescription: Optimal One-Arm Two-Stage Phase II Design with Survival Endpoint // The proposed two-stage design can be used for single-arm phase II trial designs with time-to-event endpoints, which is desirable for clinical trials on immunotherapies among cancer patients. There're two advantages of the proposed approach: 1) It provides flexible choices of four underlying survival distributions and 2) the power of the design is more accurately calculated using exact variance in one-sample log-rank test. The package can be used for 1) planning the sample size; 2) conducting the interim and final analyses for the Go/No-go decisions. More details about the design method can be found in the paper: Wu, J, Chen L, Wei J, Weiss H, Chauhan A. (2020). doi:10.1002/pst.1983.
